logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: The Step Pyramid of Djoser

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The pyramids are the most famous monuments of ancient Egypt...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'di tích' (monuments) 'của Ai Cập cổ đại' (of ancient Egypt).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Structures or buildings of historical importance from the ancient period of Egyptian civilization.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các di tích của Ai Cập cổ đại.

phase3Production.content: The Sphinx is one of the most recognizable monuments of ancient Egypt.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and still hold enormous interest for people in the present day.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Thu hút' (hold) 'sự quan tâm' (interest) 'to lớn' (enormous).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be extremely interesting or fascinating to people.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thu hút sự quan tâm to lớn.

phase3Production.content: Mysteries of the deep sea continue to hold enormous interest for scientists.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: These grand, impressive tributes to the memory of the Egyptian kings...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'vật tưởng niệm/cống phẩm' (tributes) 'lớn lao' (grand) và 'ấn tượng' (impressive).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Large and admirable acts, statements, or gifts that are intended to show respect or admiration.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những cống phẩm lớn lao, ấn tượng.

phase3Production.content: The state funeral was a grand, impressive tribute to the late queen.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The evolution of the pyramid form has been written and argued about for centuries.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'tiến hóa' (evolution) 'của' (of) 'hình dạng kim tự tháp' (the pyramid form).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The gradual development of the shape and structure of pyramids over time.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự tiến hóa của hình dạng kim tự tháp.

phase3Production.content: The book traces the evolution of the pyramid form from simple tombs to the great pyramids.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: as far as Egypt is concerned
lexicalItems.sourceContext: However, there is no question that, as far as Egypt is concerned, it began with one monument...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Xét về/Đối với' (as far as) 'Ai Cập' (Egypt) 'thì' (is concerned).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom used to introduce a topic or aspect, meaning 'in relation to Egypt' or 'speaking about Egypt'.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xét về Ai Cập, đối với Ai Cập.

phase3Production.content: As far as the economy is concerned, the new policy has been a success.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...one monument to one king designed by one brilliant architect...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'kiến trúc sư' (architect) 'tài ba/lỗi lạc' (brilliant).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An exceptionally clever or talented person who designs buildings.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kiến trúc sư lỗi lạc.

phase3Production.content: Zaha Hadid was a brilliant architect known for her futuristic designs.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Prior to Djoser's reign, tombs were rectangular monuments made of dried clay brick...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Trước' (Prior to) 'triều đại' (reign) 'của Djoser' (Djoser's).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Before the period during which King Djoser ruled.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trước triều đại của Djoser.

phase3Production.content: Prior to the queen's reign, the country was in a state of civil war.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...tombs were rectangular monuments made of dried clay brick...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'di tích' (monuments) 'hình chữ nhật' (rectangular).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Structures built as memorials that have the shape of a rectangle.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các di tích hình chữ nhật.

phase3Production.content: The ancient site consisted of several large, rectangular monuments.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...underground passages where the deceased person was buried.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Người' (person) 'đã qua đời' (deceased).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person who has recently died.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người đã khuất.

phase3Production.content: The will of the deceased person was read to the family.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Djoser's main official, whose name was Imhotep, conceived of building a taller, more impressive tomb...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Nảy ra ý tưởng/hình thành' (conceived of) 'việc xây dựng' (building).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To form an idea or plan in one's mind for constructing something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nảy ra ý tưởng/quan niệm về việc xây dựng.

phase3Production.content: He conceived of building a bridge that would span the entire river.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...by stacking stone slabs on top of one another...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Chồng/xếp' (stacking) 'các phiến đá' (stone slabs) 'lên nhau' (on top of one another).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Arranging large, flat pieces of stone in a pile, one on top of another.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Xếp chồng các phiến đá.

phase3Production.content: The wall was built by stacking large stone slabs without any mortar.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...some historians and scholars attribute a much longer time for his rule...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Gán cho/cho rằng' (attribute) 'một thời gian' (a time) 'dài hơn nhiều' (a much longer).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To regard a longer period as being caused by or belonging to someone's rule.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cho là/quy cho một thời gian dài hơn nhiều.

phase3Production.content: Archaeologists attribute a much longer time to the construction of the city than previously thought.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...owing to the number and size of the monuments he built.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Bởi vì/do' (owing to) 'số lượng và kích thước' (the number and size).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Because of or on account of.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Do, bởi vì.

phase3Production.content: The flight was delayed owing to bad weather.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The Step Pyramid has been thoroughly examined and investigated over the last century...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đã được 'kiểm tra' (examined) 'một cách kỹ lưỡng' (thoroughly).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be inspected or studied in a very detailed and careful way.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được xem xét/kiểm tra kỹ lưỡng.

phase3Production.content: The evidence was thoroughly examined by the detectives.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it is now known that the building process went through many different stages.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Quá trình xây dựng 'đã trải qua' (went through) 'nhiều' (many) 'giai đoạn' (stages) 'khác nhau' (different).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To experience or undergo a series of distinct periods or phases.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trải qua nhiều giai đoạn khác nhau.

phase3Production.content: The project went through many different stages before it was finally approved.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Historian Marc Van de Mieroop comments on this, writing ‘Much experimentation was involved...’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Rất nhiều' (Much) 'sự thử nghiệm' (experimentation) 'đã được thực hiện/có liên quan' (was involved).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A great deal of testing and trying out new ideas was part of the process.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có liên quan đến/bao gồm nhiều thử nghiệm.

phase3Production.content: Much experimentation was involved in developing the new vaccine.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The weight of the enormous mass was a challenge for the builders...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Khối lượng' (mass) 'khổng lồ' (enormous).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very large body of matter with no definite shape.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khối lượng/khối khổng lồ.

phase3Production.content: The enormous mass of the iceberg was mostly hidden beneath the water.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...who placed the stones at an inward incline in order to prevent the monument breaking up.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đặt các viên đá ở 'một độ nghiêng' (an incline) 'vào trong' (inward).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A slope that angles towards the center of a structure.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Độ dốc/nghiêng vào trong.

phase3Production.content: The walls of the dam were built with an inward incline for greater stability.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in order to prevent the monument breaking up.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'ngăn' (prevent) 'di tích' (the monument) 'bị vỡ/sụp' (breaking up).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To stop the structure from collapsing or falling apart.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ngăn không cho di tích bị vỡ.

phase3Production.content: Engineers added steel reinforcements to prevent the old bridge from breaking up.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...was the tallest structure of its time.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Công trình' (structure) 'cao nhất' (the tallest) 'thời đó' (of its time).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The highest building or construction in the world during that historical period.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Công trình cao nhất thời bấy giờ.

phase3Production.content: The Eiffel Tower was the tallest structure of its time when it was completed in 1889.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and living quarters for the priests.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Khu nhà ở/sinh hoạt' (living quarters) 'cho' (for) 'các tu sĩ' (the priests).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Rooms and areas where the priests lived; accommodation.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khu sinh hoạt cho các tu sĩ.

phase3Production.content: The castle included a chapel and separate living quarters for the royal family.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The wall had 13 false doors cut into it...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 13 'cửa giả' (false doors).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Imitations of doors carved into a wall, common in ancient Egyptian tombs, that do not function as real entrances.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cửa giả.

phase3Production.content: The tomb's burial chamber was hidden behind a series of false doors.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the entire wall was then ringed by a trench 750 meters long...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'bao quanh bởi' (ringed by) 'một con hào' (a trench).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be surrounded by a long, narrow ditch dug in the ground.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được bao quanh bởi một con hào.

phase3Production.content: The ancient fortress was ringed by a deep trench to deter attackers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The false doors and the trench were incorporated into the complex to discourage unwanted visitors.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'làm nản lòng/ngăn cản' (discourage) 'những vị khách' (visitors) 'không mong muốn' (unwanted).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To try to prevent people who are not welcome from coming or entering.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm nản lòng những vị khách không mời.

phase3Production.content: They put up a large fence to discourage unwanted visitors from entering their garden.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Djoser was so proud of his accomplishment that he broke the tradition of having only his own name on the monument...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ông ấy 'đã phá vỡ' (broke) 'truyền thống' (the tradition).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To do something different from what is usually done or has been done in the past.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phá vỡ truyền thống.

phase3Production.content: She broke the tradition in her family by deciding not to get married.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and had Imhotep's name carved on it as well.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có tên của Imhotep 'được khắc' (carved) 'lên đó' (on it).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have a name cut into the surface of a hard material like stone.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tên được khắc trên đó.

phase3Production.content: He found an old tree with his grandparents' names carved on it.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The burial chamber of the tomb, where the king's body was laid to rest...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Phòng' (chamber) 'chôn cất' (burial).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A room, often underground, where a dead person is buried.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phòng chôn cất.

phase3Production.content: The archaeologists finally entered the sealed burial chamber of the pharaoh.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...where the king's body was laid to rest...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nơi thi thể nhà vua 'được đặt xuống để an nghỉ' (was laid to rest).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning to be buried.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được an nghỉ, được chôn cất.

phase3Production.content: The famous poet was laid to rest in the village where he was born.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: beneath the base of the pyramid
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...was dug beneath the base of the pyramid...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Bên dưới' (beneath) 'phần móng/chân' (the base) 'của kim tự tháp' (of the pyramid).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Under the bottom part or foundation of the pyramid.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bên dưới chân kim tự tháp.

phase3Production.content: A network of secret tunnels was found beneath the base of the castle.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: a vast maze of long tunnels
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...surrounded by a vast maze of long tunnels that had rooms off them...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'mê cung' (maze) 'rộng lớn' (vast) gồm 'những đường hầm dài' (of long tunnels).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A large and complex network of interconnected long underground passages.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một mê cung rộng lớn gồm các đường hầm dài.

phase3Production.content: The explorers got lost in a vast maze of long tunnels beneath the city.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to discourage robbers.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'làm nản lòng' (discourage) 'những kẻ cướp' (robbers).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To try to prevent thieves from stealing.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm nản lòng những kẻ cướp.

phase3Production.content: The bank installed a new security system to discourage robbers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a large number of stone vessels.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các 'bình/chậu' (vessels) 'bằng đá' (stone).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Containers, such as bowls or jars, made of stone.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các bình/vật chứa bằng đá.

phase3Production.content: The museum's collection includes many ancient Egyptian stone vessels.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Over 40,000 of these vessels... were discovered in storerooms off the pyramid's underground passages.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'phát hiện' (discovered) 'trong' (in) 'các kho chứa' (storerooms).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Found in rooms used for storing things.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được phát hiện trong các kho chứa.

phase3Production.content: A collection of old paintings was discovered in the castle's forgotten storerooms.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: inscribed with the names of rulers
lexicalItems.sourceContext: They are inscribed with the names of rulers from the First and Second Dynasties...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'khắc' (inscribed) 'tên' (with the names) 'của các nhà cai trị' (of rulers).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have the names of kings or leaders carved or written on a surface.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được khắc tên của các nhà cai trị.

phase3Production.content: The ancient tablet was inscribed with the names of forgotten kings.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There is no agreement among scholars and archaeologists on why the vessels were placed...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Không có sự đồng thuận' (no agreement) 'giữa' (among) 'các học giả' (scholars).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A lack of consensus or shared opinion among academic experts.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không có sự đồng thuận giữa các học giả.

phase3Production.content: There is no agreement among scholars about the true purpose of Stonehenge.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...or what they were supposed to represent.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Chúng 'được cho là' (were supposed to) 'đại diện/tượng trưng cho' (represent) 'cái gì' (what).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: What their intended meaning or purpose was.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Được cho là đại diện cho.

phase3Production.content: No one is sure what the strange symbols on the cave wall were supposed to represent.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The archaeologist Jean-Philippe Lauer, who excavated most of the pyramid and complex...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Người đã 'khai quật' (excavated) 'hầu hết' (most of) 'kim tự tháp' (the pyramid).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have dug up the majority of the pyramid site to uncover ancient remains.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khai quật hầu hết kim tự tháp.

phase3Production.content: The team excavated most of the Roman villa over a period of five years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...they were originally stored and then given a ‘proper burial’ by Djoser...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được trao cho 'một lễ chôn cất' (a burial) 'đúng cách/tử tế' (proper).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A burial that is conducted correctly and with the appropriate respect or ceremony.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một lễ chôn cất đúng cách.

phase3Production.content: The family wanted to ensure their father was given a proper burial.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...by Djoser in his pyramid to honor his predecessors.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'tôn vinh' (honor) 'những người tiền nhiệm' (his predecessors) 'của ông' (his).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To show great respect for the people who held a position or job before him.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tôn vinh những người tiền nhiệm của mình.

phase3Production.content: The new CEO gave a speech to honor his predecessors and their contributions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the vessels were dumped into the shafts as yet another attempt to prevent grave robbers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Các bình 'bị ném/vứt' (were dumped) 'vào' (into) 'các hầm/giếng' (the shafts).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be thrown or dropped carelessly into deep, narrow vertical passages.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị ném vào các hầm.

phase3Production.content: Old equipment was simply dumped into the mineshafts after the mine closed.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to prevent grave robbers from getting to the king's burial chamber.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'ngăn chặn' (prevent) 'những kẻ cướp mộ' (grave robbers).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To stop people who steal valuable objects from tombs.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ngăn chặn những kẻ cướp mộ.

phase3Production.content: The tombs were filled with traps to prevent grave robbers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Unfortunately, all of the precautions and intricate design of the underground network did not prevent...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Tất cả 'các biện pháp phòng ngừa' (the precautions) 'và' (and) 'thiết kế' (design) 'phức tạp/tinh xảo' (intricate).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Actions taken in advance to prevent something dangerous, and a very complicated or detailed plan or pattern.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các biện pháp phòng ngừa và thiết kế phức tạp.

phase3Production.content: Despite all the security precautions and the intricate design of the vault, the thieves still got in.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...design of the underground network did not prevent ancient robbers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Mạng lưới' (network) 'dưới lòng đất' (underground).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A system of connected tunnels or passages below the surface of the ground.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mạng lưới ngầm.

phase3Production.content: The city has a complex underground network of subway lines.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Djoser's grave goods, and even his body, were stolen at some point in the past...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đồ tùy táng' (grave goods) 'của Djoser' (Djoser's).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The items buried along with a dead person.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đồ tùy táng của Djoser.

phase3Production.content: The king's tomb was filled with priceless grave goods, including a golden mask.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...were stolen at some point in the past...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'đánh cắp' (stolen) 'vào một thời điểm nào đó' (at some point).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have been taken without permission at an unspecified time.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị đánh cắp vào một thời điểm nào đó.

phase3Production.content: My bicycle was stolen at some point during the night.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...all archaeologists found were a small number of his valuables overlooked by the thieves.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'vật có giá trị' (valuables) 'bị bỏ qua' (overlooked) 'bởi những tên trộm' (by the thieves).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Items of high worth that the robbers failed to notice or take.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những vật có giá trị bị bọn trộm bỏ sót.

phase3Production.content: The police found a hidden safe containing valuables overlooked by the thieves.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There was enough left throughout the pyramid and its complex, however, to astonish and amaze the archaeologists who excavated it.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Đủ để 'làm kinh ngạc và sửng sốt' (astonish and amaze) 'các nhà khảo cổ' (the archaeologists).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To surprise the archaeologists very much.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm kinh ngạc và sửng sốt các nhà khảo cổ.

phase3Production.content: The discovery was so unexpected that it continued to astonish and amaze the scientists.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: hold a place in human history
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘Few monuments hold a place in human history as significant as that of the Step Pyramid in Saqqara ...’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Giữ một vị trí' (hold a place) 'trong lịch sử loài người' (in human history).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have an important or recognized position in the story of humanity.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giữ một vị trí trong lịch sử nhân loại.

phase3Production.content: The invention of the printing press will always hold a place in human history.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as significant as that of the Step Pyramid...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Quan trọng như' (as significant as).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Equally important or noteworthy as.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Quan trọng như.

phase3Production.content: His contribution to science was as significant as that of his famous mentor.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It can be said without exaggeration that this pyramid complex constitutes a milestone...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Không hề phóng đại' (without exaggeration).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An idiom meaning 'it is true to say'; not overstating something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không hề phóng đại.
relatedCollocates: it is no exaggeration to say

phase3Production.content: It can be said without exaggeration that this is the best movie of the year.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...this pyramid complex constitutes a milestone in the evolution of monumental stone architecture...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tạo thành/là' (constitutes) 'một cột mốc' (a milestone).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be or be considered as a significant stage or event in the development of something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tạo thành một cột mốc.

phase3Production.content: The moon landing constitutes a milestone in human exploration.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in the evolution of monumental stone architecture in Egypt and in the world as a whole.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Kiến trúc' (architecture) 'bằng đá' (stone) 'hoành tráng/vĩ đại' (monumental).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The art and science of designing and constructing very large and impressive buildings made of stone.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kiến trúc đá hoành tráng.

phase3Production.content: The ancient Romans were masters of monumental stone architecture.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The Step Pyramid was a revolutionary advance in architecture...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'bước tiến' (advance) 'mang tính cách mạng' (revolutionary).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A great and important improvement or development that completely changes the way something is done.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một bước tiến mang tính cách mạng.

phase3Production.content: The invention of the internet was a revolutionary advance in communication.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and became the archetype which all the other great pyramid builders of Egypt would follow.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Và 'trở thành' (became) 'nguyên mẫu' (the archetype).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To become a very typical example of a certain person or thing; a model for later examples.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trở thành nguyên mẫu.

phase3Production.content: The hero of this story became the archetype for many later adventure novels.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...all the other great pyramid builders of Egypt would follow.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'người xây' (builders) 'kim tự tháp' (pyramid).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The people who constructed the pyramids.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những người xây kim tự tháp.

phase3Production.content: The skill of the ancient pyramid builders is still admired today.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...for people in the present day.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Với mọi người 'ngày nay' (in the present day).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: At the current time; nowadays.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ngày nay.

phase3Production.content: Even in the present day, some ancient traditions are still practiced.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Djoser was the first king of the Third Dynasty of Egypt...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Vương triều thứ ba' (Third Dynasty).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A specific period in ancient Egyptian history, a line of hereditary rulers.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vương triều thứ ba.

phase3Production.content: The Old Kingdom of Egypt began with the Third Dynasty.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: in the center of the complex
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...especially clear in the construction of the pyramid in the center of the complex.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Ở trung tâm' (in the center) 'của khu phức hợp' (of the complex).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: At the middle point of the group of buildings.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ở trung tâm của khu phức hợp.

phase3Production.content: A large fountain stood in the center of the complex.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with only one true entrance cut into the south-east corner...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Góc' (corner) 'đông nam' (south-east).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The point where the south and east sides of something meet.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Góc đông nam.

phase3Production.content: The entrance to the park is at the south-east corner.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...needed to know in advance how to find the location of the true opening in the wall.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tìm vị trí của' (find the location of).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To discover the place or position of something.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tìm vị trí của.

phase3Production.content: The treasure hunters used an old map to find the location of the buried chest.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Over 40,000 of these vessels, of various forms and shapes, were discovered...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Có 'nhiều' (various) 'hình thức' (forms) 'và' (and) 'hình dạng' (shapes) 'khác nhau' (various).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having many different types of structures and outlines.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Với nhiều hình thức và hình dạng khác nhau.

phase3Production.content: The collection included pottery of various forms and shapes.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: made from different kinds of stone
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and made from different kinds of stone.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'làm từ' (made from) 'các loại' (kinds) 'đá' (of stone) 'khác nhau' (different).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Constructed using several types of rock.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm từ các loại đá khác nhau.

phase3Production.content: The mosaic was made from different kinds of stone to create the pattern.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as yet another attempt to prevent grave robbers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Như 'thêm một' (yet another) 'nỗ lực/cố gắng' (attempt).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: One more effort in a series of efforts.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thêm một nỗ lực nữa.

phase3Production.content: This was yet another attempt to break the world record.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: in the world as a whole
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...in Egypt and in the world as a whole.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Và 'trên toàn thế giới nói chung' (in the world as a whole).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Considering the entire world, not just one part of it.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trên thế giới nói chung.

phase3Production.content: The pandemic affected the economy of not just one country, but the world as a whole.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which all the other great pyramid builders of Egypt would follow.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Mà tất cả những người xây dựng kim tự tháp vĩ đại khác 'sẽ noi theo' (would follow).

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To use as a model or example to be copied in the future.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sẽ noi theo.

phase3Production.content: He set a high standard that all future athletes would follow.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Djoser was so proud of his accomplishment...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Rất tự hào về 'thành tựu' (accomplishment) của mình.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Something that has been achieved successfully, especially after a lot of effort.
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thành tựu.

phase3Production.content: Building the pyramid was a remarkable accomplishment for its time.
